text.51_Chapter, 5_Verse: At this time, God's own light is inside you, beckoning you to draw near.  This arousal is a spark of God's own Essence.
text.51_Chapter, 0_Verse: It is written, "The whole earth is filled with His glory" (Isaiah 6:3).
text.51_Chapter, 1_Verse: God's glory cries out from all things.
text.51_Chapter, 7_Verse: [And sometimes] when God withdraws and is far off, you must still pray to Him.  It is written, "Throw your burden upon God" (Psalms 55:23). You must literally throw your prayers towards God from afar.  The Tikkuney Zohar (#21, 61b) states, "Happy is the man who knows how to throw arrows."  These are the prayers that must be thrown towards God.
text.51_Chapter, 2_Verse: Even the stories of all nations ring with God's glory.  This is the meaning of the verse, "Let the nations tell of His glory" (Psalms 96:3).  It is even reflected in their tales.
text.51_Chapter, 3_Verse: God's glory always cries out, calling you to come close to Him.  For God, with all His love and mercy, wants you to be close.
text.51_Chapter, 6_Verse: It is written, "He is your praise, He is your God" (Deuteronomy 10:21).  God Himself is in your praise and prayer, and at times, you pray right in front of God.
text.51_Chapter, 4_Verse: Sometimes in the middle of your prayers, you become enflamed and the words flow from your lips with burning devotion.
